page.title: 04A Shiskine Shepherd's Year
page.content: {Nov-Dec}Tups are put out. {Jan-Feb}Some early lambing-animals kept indoors or near the farm {Mar-Apr}Most lambs are born-this is the busiest time of the year. Sheep are dozed for worms {June} This is 'marking' time-lug marks (cuts in ears) to show ownership {Jul-Aug}Sheep shearing-fleeces are packed in huge canvas sacks which are sent to the mainland {Sept} Most lambs have been sent to market in Brodick, Lanark or Paisley. Sheep are dipped to free them from tics and paracites. The most popular breed of sheep in the valley is the blackfaced sheep. Some shepherds now use a motor bike to tend their sheep.
